dabdb380-380d-51d4-8c20-475c956666c2.title: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure all subsurface drainage pipes ordered are Category 1: peroforated plastics Class 1000 and Precast concrete Class 2.

6c13ac55-9831-5a04-a30c-f8d7f1575240.title: Record of Conformity: Insert Teambinder Material Approval Number

ac6cb323-cf69-5023-86dd-90ce9314a695.title: All subsurface drainage pipes shall have a maximum perforation width of 1.5mm and a minimum length of 150mm/m2.

ce815aed-438a-507e-925c-6a9547110cf4.title: Acceptance Criteria: Type 2 drainage (NFC) Geotextile filter to meet requirements of a First Stage filter as per Table 702.061

d1230d0e-03aa-5d38-9036-f5c38d847216.title: Type 2 NFC Grade B4 Filter Material

228040bd-2fc9-597c-94b8-672a1486c6a8.title: Reference Documents: Project Spec. Cl.3030.05(a), Table 702.131

9a710fe6-5723-5394-b6ef-4475ff697e85.title: Record of Conformity: Insert Teambinder Material Approval Number

db693077-e3c9-5949-925b-1581b098ed74.title: Minimum testing requirements are reflected inline with 702.13.

2528f249-7ed0-52e0-a595-450eba6d5dbc.title: Acceptance Criteria: Type 2 and 3 backfill material types to be reviewed against specification and approved prior to ordering and use.

8b6e0939-fcf4-54d4-906f-7ee0ec0e046f.title: Reference Documents: SD 1611 Issue D SD 1631 Issue E

556b47bb-a811-501c-a46e-9e41975168da.title: Flushout Risers SD 1631 and Type S1 Pits reflect VR SD 1611.

f194d4c3-e594-5699-b963-c3100e0de8d6.title: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure compaction methodology of No Fines Backfill developed and submitted for review prior.

8e6c0895-14f8-5e45-a13b-86ac68e29262.title: Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used

870d384c-596d-5fd2-b6fe-0f5e1c07f985.title: Reference Documents: Project Drawings / Drawing Register

8de5badf-4fe1-5279-8c10-7a65c52f26dc.title: Record of Conformity: Latest Revision Drawings

meta.name: 2.1 - Check current revision drawings are being used

2cb5cef0-38c6-5158-9d3c-2f77454acbf0.title: Acceptance Criteria: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed. Ensure DYBD Plans and Drawings relating to the particular area are available, current and where applicable highlights temporary services installed by Contractor

0734f01a-30eb-5c01-83a4-ea1aea98380f.title: Where backfill is required above subgrade level, backfilling must be with pavement material that matches the pavement design for that pavement.

77e112e2-8b32-5fc8-95ca-a62f67452bee.title: The area is backfilled with Type A material to subgrade or surface level.

2744fc66-3eac-5cd8-9889-883befae38a6.title: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure removal and disposal of all redundant pre-existing subsurface drainage assets.

66c64909-2752-51b2-ac8d-022c74d818c1.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.702.08 VicRoads Spec. Cl.702.09(a)(b)

9766e83f-8b57-5311-9a6e-8312944027d9.title: Grade of trench to be not flatter than 1 in 250 gradient.

7ea3bbc1-d95a-58f9-a074-b71585b220a4.title: The top of any subsurface drainage pipe shall be at least 300 mm below the subbase and setup for the subsurface drain type.

3234c0b1-c504-5fb6-98a9-041495963951.title: Base of the trench shall be inspected to verify compliance with the requirements prior to placing bedding in completed excavations.

bdcd2da8-0928-56c9-841b-57717ce2de38.title: Acceptance Criteria: The base of the trench shall be sufficiently compacted and not more than 50mm below the invert level of the pipe to be placed.

1eca2e27-0a17-5429-b443-41f2c1ab1c0e.title: Acceptance Criteria: Where geotextile is to be used as a first stage filter in contact with a trench wall, the trench wall shall be excavated to allow the geotextile to be in close contact with the wall when granular material is placed.

985c29f9-5d2c-5872-9456-e052bab9eafd.title: The appropriate Subsurface Drainage Type 2 (B4 NFC filter) or Type 3 (Grade A4 to A6 filter) has been setup prior to backfill.

4c45b69e-e4dc-50e6-9608-afd77dfa717d.title: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure bedding of thickness between 25-50mm is placed across the bottom of trench and graded to level.

25618bbd-2dac-5143-b038-6276e72b0129.title: Flushout Risers, S1 Type Pits and Outlets are appropriate positioned to reflect the subsurface drainage design.

2a768a6e-4047-53b3-8bd1-35620a55fd88.title: Pipes are firmly in place, slotted pipes positioned so openings are in lower half of the pipe.

1536e111-b6f7-5938-b5e4-148c87358b36.title: Filter material shall be moistened and compacted with minimal disturbance to pipes. The loose thickness of layers shall not exceed 300 mm.

d5b02def-621d-57ce-9af1-fcf91b145a14.title: For Type 2 (NFC) No-fines concrete shall be placed and compacted within 1 hour of mixing.

a4bd392b-a5fe-5043-9c0a-a6d7eeedfb75.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.702.09(g) Project Spec. Cl.3030.05(b)

8f61f1cc-0ccb-5dad-a8c2-2da8392abf34.title: Acceptance Criteria: Filter socks must not be installed on subsurface drains backfilled with no fines concrete (Type 2). (HP)

25e71990-ade7-579e-8dfb-42c083d75d81.title: Acceptance Criteria: Marker posts installed at all subsurface outlets, and must be 75 mm diameter x 1500mm treated pine inserted 600mm into the ground.

meta.name: 3.7 - Installation of Subsurface Outlet marker posts (If required)

0f359665-83e4-5909-9c19-f1aac39e7a14.title: Acceptance Criteria: Flushing test shall be witnessed by a representative nominated by the superintendent and shall confirm that the drainage line is free of obstruction.

0793f070-9946-5616-b201-dc726c72e456.title: Verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.

4fef94e1-a641-5788-9353-0d37c986cae7.title: Record of Conformity: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests

18cec18b-8640-5667-b8a8-4ef99d076521.title: Placement of asphalt cannot proceed until after this inspection. CCTV is completed, damaged or deformed drainage pipe removed and replaced. Along with waste and defect free condition of lines verified by the Superintendent.

d4673731-ace1-5d8a-8767-9fecf3707e3f.title: Acceptance Criteria: All subsurface drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of the flushing test as stated in clause 702.09(h) and prior to placement of asphalt, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV),
